data.profileText: a Representative from Massachusetts; born in Nantucket, Mass., May 30, 1759; received a limited schooling; was a successful shipmaster, and later became a shipowner; also engaged in mercantile pursuits; elected as a Democratic Republican to the Eleventh Congress (March 4, 1809-March 3, 1811); resumed his former business pursuits; was the bearer of a petition from the citizens of Nantucket to Congress for tax relief in 1813; died in Nantucket, Mass., March 22, 1832; interment in Friends Burying Ground.

researchRecord.name: In the Gardner Family Papers, 1717-1911, 2.5 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Includes papers of Gideon Gardner regarding problems encountered by islanders during the War of 1812. A finding aid is available in the repository.
